bddtester.core.bdd.steps

Class TypeSteps<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bddtester.core.bdd.steps.TypeSteps<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the Testdata.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Statusable

    public class TypeSteps<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Statusable
    Describes a scenario with only one data set.
    Thus, it has the given, when, then, and methods.
    Author:
    ckeiner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TypeSteps()
      Creates a BddTypeScenario.
      TypeSteps(java.util.List<TypeStep<T>> steps)
      Creates a BddTypeScenario with the specified list of steps.
      TypeSteps(java.util.List<TypeStep<T>> steps, java.util.List<Before> befores)
      Creates a BddTypeScenario with the specified reporter and list of Steps and Befores.
      TypeSteps(java.util.List<TypeStep<T>> steps, java.util.List<Before> befores, java.util.List<After> afters)
      Creates a BddTypeScenario with the specified reporter and list of Steps, Befores and Afters.

      • TypeSteps

        public TypeSteps(java.util.List<TypeStep<T>> steps,
                 java.util.List<Before> befores)
        Creates a BddTypeScenario with the specified reporter and list of Steps and Befores.
        Parameters:
        steps - The list of steps to execute.
        befores - The list of Befores to execute before each other steps.

      • TypeSteps

        public TypeSteps(java.util.List<TypeStep<T>> steps,
                 java.util.List<Before> befores,
                 java.util.List<After> afters)
        Creates a BddTypeScenario with the specified reporter and list of Steps, Befores and Afters.
        Parameters:
        steps - The list of steps to execute.
        befores - The list of Befores to execute before the other steps.
        afters - The list of Afterss to execute after the other steps.

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public void test()
        Executes the scenario.
        If an exception or error occurs in the steps, the steps which weren't executed yet, are set to be skipped. Afterwards, the exception or error is re-thrown as StepException and StepError respectively.
        Should both, an exception and an error, occur, a StepException is thrown.

      • skipSteps

        public void skipSteps()

      • and

        public TypeSteps<T> and(Steps scenario)
        Adds all steps of the specified scenario to the steps of this BddTypeScenario.
        Parameters:
        scenario - The Steps which steps should be added to the steps of this class.
        Returns:
        The current BddTypeScenario.

        public TypeSteps<T> and(java.lang.String description,

        Adds the step specified by the description and consumer to this scenario.
        The GherkinKeyword of the step is "And".
        Parameters:

        consumer - The behavior of this step.

        The current BddTypeScenario.
